title: Public urged to take action as cyclonic conditions build near Eastern coast
byline: Authorities have urged the public to take action as a developing weather system in the Bay of Bengal is expected to bring heavy rain and strong winds to several parts of the country.

title: CB Governor gives upbeat assessment of economy with 2026 growth set at 5%
byline: Central Bank Governor, Dr. Nandalal Weerasinghe kicked off the New Year with policies aimed at shifting gears from recovery in the economy to an enhanced growth while building resilience.

title: UK trade reforms open door to tariff-free Sri Lankan garment exports from January 1
byline: Sri Lanka’s garment industry is set for a fresh export boost after sweeping reforms to the United Kingdom’s Developing Countries Trading Scheme (DCTS) came into force on January 1, granting tariff-free access to

title: Sri Lanka, EU ink €8 mn grant to drive green growth in rubber sector
byline: Sri Lanka has secured a €8 million grant from the European Union to accelerate its transition to green economic growth, with a targeted push to modernise and decarbonise segments of the country’s rubber

title: India awaits Sri Lanka’s response to detailed project report request
byline: India awaits Sri Lanka’s response to the proposal for a detailed project report on land connectivity between the two countries, an official said yesterday.

title: An official and a few NGOs behind Grade Six module issue: MP
byline: An official named Dharshana Samaraweera and few NGOs promoting homosexuality are behind the crisis pertaining to the Grade Six module issue, an opposition MP told Parliament yesterday.

title: Divisional Secretary probed over alleged fake marriage documents
byline: Police have launched a special investigation following a complaint alleging that a Divisional Secretary currently serving at a Divisional Secretariat in the Ratnapura District had prepared fraudulent documents in connection with her marriage.

title: Deep depression crossing Sri Lanka, be vigilant for flash floods, landslides - Met. Dept.
byline: A depression which occurred in the Bay of Bengal has intensified into a deep depression and is crossing Sri Lanka today and warnings have been sent out by the Department of Meteorology to be prepared for flash floods, crop destruction, power cuts, damage to huts and uprooting of trees.

title: D.V. Chanaka challenges energy minister over alleged coal tender corruption
byline: Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna MP D.V. Chanaka has publicly challenged Energy Minister Kumara Jayakody to a televised debate over alleged corruption in a recent coal import tender.

title: Delay in procuring advanced radiotherapy machines raising cancer mortality, warn experts
byline: The lack of modern radiotherapy technology in Sri Lanka is worsening the quality of life for cancer patients and increasing mortality rates, particularly for those suffering from cervical, endometrial, prostate, rectal, anal, breast, head, neck, and skin cancers, medical experts warn.

title: Govt to build 31,000 houses following $4.1 bn disaster losses, Says President
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake announced that the government plans to build 31,000 new houses after the World Bank estimated Sri Lanka’s disaster-related losses at USD 4.1 billion.

title: Elephant calf killed in lorry collision in Galgamuwa
byline: A two-year-old elephant calf was killed after a herd of elephants collided with a lorry on the Anuradhapura–Padeniya road in the Galgamuwa Mee Oya area, wildlife officials said.

title: Sri Pada Hatton route declared safe after NBRO inspection
byline: Pilgrims can now safely access Sri Pada via the Hatton route, as the National Building Research Organisation (NBRO) has confirmed that there is no longer a risk of landslides in the Mahagiridamba area, Venerable Dorapane Sumanajothi Thera said.

title: Demerit system to lead to cancellation of driving licences and route permits – Minister
byline: A demerit system under which driving licences of habitual traffic offenders and route permits of buses will be cancelled is to be introduced soon to enhance road safety, Minister of Transport Bimal Rathnayake told Parliament yesterday.

title: Harini’s justifications of her errors disgraceful: Lihini Fernando
byline: While categorically and vehemently rejecting the vile, personalised attacks that have been directed at Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya, Moratuwa Municipal Councillor of the Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB), Lihini Fernando said the Prime Minister failed as the Minister of Education and disappointed and disgusted with her disgraceful justifications of her errors.

title: Over 177,000 still live with relatives after Ditwah
byline: In the wake of Cyclone Ditwah, more than 177,000 people are currently living in the homes of relatives and friends, according to the Disaster Management Centre (DMC).

title: Internet blackout in Iran as large anti-government protests held across country
byline: Iran was plunged into a nationwide internet blackout Thursday evening as mass anti-government protests spread around the country, with Iranians shouting slogans against the ruling theocratic regime as anger mounts over economic turmoil and security crackdowns.

title: SLAP and NAITA Join forces to boost skilled workforce for Sri Lanka’s printing industry
byline: In a significant move to strengthen Sri Lanka’s printing industry, the National Apprentice and Industrial Training Authority (NAITA) and the Sri Lanka Association of Printers (SLAP) recently held discussions to develop industry-focused training programs aimed at producing a future-ready workforce.

title: Deep depression path shifts: No cyclone expected, Meteorology Department confirms
byline: The path of the deep depression approaching Sri Lanka has shifted, and it is no longer expected to develop into a cyclonic storm, the Director General of the Meteorological Department, Athula Karunanayake, said today.

title: Speaker rejects Opposition request for select committee on judicial appointments
byline: Speaker Jagath Wickramaratne today dismissed a request by the Opposition to appoint a select committee to probe the appointments, transfers and promotions of judicial officers.

title: Have the right to ensure correct information is disseminated to people: Media Minister
byline: Media Minister Nalinda Jayatissa told Parliament today that he is committed to ensuring that accurate information is disseminated to the public.

title: Uva Province schools to cose early due to adverse weather
byline: All schools in the Uva Province will close at 11:45 a.m. today due to the risk of adverse weather conditions, Chief Secretary Anusha Gokula Fernando said.

title: CID probing evidence destruction in high-profile cases
byline: Public Security Minister Ananda Wijepala said investigations into several high-profile cases are progressing, with the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) conducting comprehensive inquiries to identify those who tampered with or destroyed crucial evidence linked to the cases.

title: Johnston Fernando further remanded
byline: The Wattala Magistrate’s Court has ordered the further remand of five suspects, including former Minister Johnston Fernando and his two sons, until January 23.

title: CAA to expand consumer awareness drive in 2026
byline: Following a landmark year in consumer education, the Consumer Affairs Authority (CAA) has announced plans to further strengthen and expand its awareness programs in 2026, targeting the general public, schoolchildren, and the business community.

title: Supreme Court to resume operations at refurbished original building from January 26
byline: The Supreme Court will resume operations at the newly refurbished original Supreme Court building at the Superior Courts Complex with effect from January 26, 2026, the Registrar of the Supreme Court announced.

title: Government to establish prison in Welisara
byline: The Ministry of Justice and National Integration has issued an extraordinary gazette notification to establish a prison in Welisara.

title: Turkish Airlines introduces A350-900 on Istanbul–Colombo route
byline: Turkish Airlines has upgraded its Istanbul–Colombo route with the introduction of the state-of-the-art Airbus A350-900 aircraft, Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) announced with delight.

title: Court revises bail condition of Ex Moratuwa Mayor
byline: Colombo Chief Magistrate Asanga S. Bodaragama today ordered the modification of a bail condition imposed on former Mayor of the Moratuwa Municipal Council Saman Lal Fernando who has been produced before court as a suspect in a corruption related case.

title: Ashoka Chakra used in Buddhism book instead of Dharmachakra: Sajith
byline: Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa said another serious error has been reported in the Buddhism subject where the Ashoka Chakra has been used instead of the Dharmachakra in the Buddhism book.

title: Gampola labour office to be temporarily closed Jan 9
byline: The Department of Labour announces that the Gampola Labour Office, located at P.B. Panabokka Mawatha, Gampola, will be temporarily closed with effect from 9 January 2026.

title: 65 cases withdrawn during previous governments re-filed: PM
byline: A total of 65 cases that had been withdrawn between 2019 and 2024 have been re-filed by the present government, Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya told Parliament today.

title: Douglas Devananda released on bail
byline: Former Minister Douglas Devananda, who was remanded in connection with an investigation into a missing firearm, was granted bail by Gampaha Magistrate Seelani Perera.

title: Construction halted in Ambuluwawa environmental zone
byline: The Ministry of Environment has directed the Central Environment Authority (CEA) to immediately suspend all construction activities within the Ambuluwawa Environmental Zone until a comprehensive risk assessment is carried out.

title: Protests in Iran cause widespread flight cancelations
byline: Major airlines have canceled dozens of flights to and from Iranian cities as a result of widespread protests throughout Iran, fueled by economic hardship.

title: Multi-vehicle crash at Mawanella leaves one killed, several injured
byline: One person was killed and several others were injured when two buses and a lorry were involved in a collision on the Colombo–Kandy main road in the Palpatha area of Mawanella around 3.30 p.m. today (09), police said.

title: ’’We will not ask people to wait until 2048,’’ says AKD
byline: Although the lives lost in the disaster cannot be replaced, the Government will provide every possible form of assistance to help the affected communities and that he will not ask the people to wait until 2048 for relief, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake said.

title: Arogya mobile health clinic for Colombo Nattami Community
byline: The Ministry of Health and Mass Media will conduct an Arogya mobile health clinic for the Colombo Nattami community and their family members on January 10, 2026.

title: Govt publishes amended terrorism designation list
byline: An amended list of designated persons, groups and entities has been published through an Extraordinary Gazette under the United Nations Act, No. 45 of 1968.

title: Red landslide evacuation warnings issued for several areas
byline: The National Building Research Organisation (NBRO) has issued Red (Level 3) Landslide Evacuation Warnings for several high-risk areas amid prevailing weather conditions in Sri Lanka.

title: Cigarette haul: Two arrested in Colombo
byline: Two suspects were arrested in Colombo’s Aluthkade area during a joint operation conducted by the Sri Lanka Navy and the Police on January 8, after around 1,560 foreign-manufactured cigarettes were found in their possession.

title: Dehiwala hotel owner dies after shooting
byline: The owner of a hotel on Marine Drive in Dehiwala has died after being shot earlier this evening, police said.

title: Second T20 between Pakistan and Sri Lanka abandoned due to rain
byline: Rain played spoilsport in the Pakistan tour of Sri Lanka as the second Twenty20 International at the Rangiri Dambulla International Stadium was abandoned due to persistent downpours on Friday evening.

title: Market closes week on strong note with fifth consecutive gain
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) extended its rally on Friday, recording its fifth consecutive session of gains as improving investor sentiment and encouraging macroeconomic signals continued to support market momentum.

title: Shooting reported in Dehiwala, one injured
byline: A shooting incident was reported a short while ago in the Beach Road area of Dehiwala, leaving one person injured, police said.

title: Lane closed on Colombo–Kandy road
byline: One lane of the Colombo–Kandy main road will be temporarily closed near Kadawatha owing to ongoing construction work, police said.

title: US seizes another oil tanker linked to Venezuela, officials say
byline: US forces have seized another tanker in the Caribbean Sea, officials said, as Washington continues its efforts to control exports of Venezuelan oil.
